  <div class="stackedit__html"><h1 id="rsa--digital-signatures">13 RSA &amp; Digital Signatures</h1>
<p>RSA was among the first public-key cryptography developed. It was first described in <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1978</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1978,</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83888em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord">1978</span><span class="mpunct">,</span></span></span></span></span> and is named after its creators, Ron Rivest, Adi Shamir, and Len Adleman. <sup class="footnote-ref"><a href="#fn1" id="fnref1">1</a></sup> RSA can be used as a building block for public-key encryption and digital signatures. In this chapter we discuss only the application of RSA for digital signatures.</p>
<h2 id="dividing-mod-n">13.1 “Dividing” Mod <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span></h2>
<p><strong>to-do</strong></p>
<blockquote>
<p><em>I’m considering moving some of this material to Chapter 3 (secret sharing) - enough to understand that every nonzero element has a multiplicative inverses modulo a prime (totients, etc can stay here). That way, I don’t have to say “trust me, this can be made to work” when describing Lagrange interpolation over a prime field, and students can play around with secret sharing using Sage. Also, students will see that there is “serious math” in the course already in chapter 3 so they don’t get blindsided as we transition into public-keycrypto. (Not to mention, this chapter is too long.)</em></p>
</blockquote>
<p>Please review the material from Section <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.2,</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83888em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord">0.2</span><span class="mpunct">,</span></span></span></span></span> to make sure your understanding of basic modular arithmetic is fresh. You should be comfortable with the definitions of <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="double-struck">Z</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathbb{Z}_{n}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83889em; <p>Note that we haven’t mentioned division <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow> <mo lspace="0.22em" rspace="0.22em"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow></mo> <mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\bmod n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.69444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.0555556em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">mod</span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.0555556em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span>. Does it even make sense to talk about division mod <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo stretchy="false">?</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n ?</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.69444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span><span class="mclose">?</span></span></span></span></span></p>
<p><strong>Example</strong><br>
<em>Consider the following facts which hold mod 15:</em><br>

\begin{array}{ll}
2 \cdot 8 \equiv_{15} 1 &amp; 10 \cdot 8 \equiv_{15} 5 \\
4 \cdot 8 \equiv_{15} 2 &amp; 12 \cdot 8 \equiv_{15} 6 \\
6 \cdot 8 \equiv_{15} 3 &amp; 14 \cdot 8 \equiv_{15} 7 \\
8 \cdot 8 \equiv_{15} 4 &amp;
\end{array}

<p><em>Everything still makes sense! Somehow, multiplying by 8 mod 15 seems to be the same thing as "dividing by <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">"</mi> <mo lspace="0.22em" rspace="0.22em"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow></mo> <mn>15.</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">2 " \bmod 15 .</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.69444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">2"</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.0555556em;"></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin"><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">mod</span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.0555556em;"></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">15.</span></span></span></span></span></em></p>

What happens when <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span></span></span></span></span> is an odd number?</em><br>
<span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>⋅</mo><mn>8</mn><msub><mo>≡</mo><mn>15</mn></msub><mn>9</mn><mo>⟺</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">"</mi><mn>3</mn><mo>÷</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mo>≡</mo><mn>15</mn></msub><mn>9</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">"</mi><mrow><mtext mathvariant="italic">?</mtext><mtext>&nbsp;</mtext><mtext mathvariant="italic">?</mtext></mrow></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">

This example shows that there is surely some interesting relationship among the numbers <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>8</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">2,8,</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83888em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">8</span><span class="mpunct">,</span></span></span></span></span> and <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>15.</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">15 .</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">15.</span></span></span></span></span> It seems reasonable to interpret "multiplication by 8 " as "division by 2 when working mod <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>15.</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">15 .</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">15.</span></span></span></span></span></p>
<p>Is there a way we can do something similar for "division by 3 " mod 15? <p>Why can we "divide by <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">"</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">2 "</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.69444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">2"</span></span></span></span></span> mod 15 but we apparently cannot "divide by 3 " mod 15 ? <h3 id="multiplicative-inverses">Multiplicative Inverses</h3>
<p>We usually don’t directly use the terminology of “division” with modular arithmetic. Instead of saying "division by 2 ", we say "multiplication by <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>"&nbsp;</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">2^{-1 \text {" }}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.849108em; <p><strong>Definition 13.1 (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x^{-1}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.814108em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.814108em;"><span class="" style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">−</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> mod <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span>)</strong></p>

We usually refer to the multiplicative inverse of <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span></span></span></span></span> as “<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x^{-1}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.814108em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.814108em;"><span class="" style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">−</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>.”</em></p>
<p><strong>Example</strong><br>
<em>Continuing to work mod <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>15</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">15,</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83888em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord">15</span><span class="mpunct">,</span></span></span></span></span> we have:</em></p>
<ul>
<li><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mn>4</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><msub><mo>≡</mo><mn>15</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">4^{-1} \equiv_{15} 4</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.964108em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord">16</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel"><span class="mrel">≡</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">15</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> 1. <em>Hence 4 is its own multiplicative inverse! You can also understand this as:</em><br>
<span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.1600em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msup><mn>4</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo fence="true">(</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo fence="true">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo fence="true">(</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo fence="true">)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><msub><mo>≡</mo><mn>15</mn></msub><msup><mn>8</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>64</mn><msub><mo>≡</mo><mn>15</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
\begin{array}{l}
4^{-1}=\left(2^{2}\right)^{-1}=\left(2^{-1}\right)^{2} \equiv _{15}8^{2}=64 \equiv_{15} 4 \\
\end{array}

<p>We are interested in which numbers have a multiplicative inverse mod <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span>.</p>
<p><strong>Definition 13.2 <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msubsup><mi mathvariant="double-struck">Z</mi><mi>n</mi><mo>∗</mo></msubsup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">(\mathbb{Z}_n^*)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathbb">Z</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.688696em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.453em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">n</span></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">∗</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.247em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></strong><br>
<em>The <strong>multiplicative group</strong> <sup class="footnote-ref"><a href="#fn2" id="fnref2">2</a></sup><strong>modulo</strong> <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span> is defined as:</em></p>
<p><span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msubsup><mi mathvariant="double-struck">Z</mi><mi>n</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∗</mo></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo fence="true">{</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>∈</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="double-struck">Z</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>∣</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mtext>&nbsp;</mtext><mtext mathvariant="italic">has</mtext><mtext>&nbsp;</mtext><mtext mathvariant="italic">a</mtext><mtext>&nbsp;</mtext><mtext mathvariant="italic">multiplicative</mtext><mtext>&nbsp;</mtext><mtext mathvariant="italic">inverse</mtext><mtext>&nbsp;</mtext><mtext mathvariant="italic">mod</mtext><mtext>&nbsp;</mtext></mrow><mi>n</mi><mo fence="true">}</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
\mathbb{Z}_{n}^{*}=\left\{x \in \mathbb{Z}_{n} \mid x \textit{ has a multiplicative inverse mod } n\right\}
</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.985696em; vertical-align: -0.247em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathbb">Z</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.738696em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.453em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">n</span></span></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.113em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">∗</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.247em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="minner"><span class="mopen delimcenter" style="top: 0em;">{</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">∈</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathbb">Z</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.151392em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; <p>For example, we have seen that <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msubsup><mi mathvariant="double-struck">Z</mi><mi>n</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∗</mo></msubsup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathbb{Z}_{n}^{*}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.93589em; vertical-align: -0.247em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathbb">Z</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.688696em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.453em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">∗</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.247em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> contains the numbers <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">2,4,</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83888em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">4</span><span class="mpunct">,</span></span></span></span></span> and 7 (and perhaps others), but it doesn’t contain the number 3 since 3 does not have a multiplicative inverse.</p>
<p>So which numbers have a multiplicative inverse mod <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span>, in general? (Which numbers belong to <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="double-struck">Z</mi><msub><mo>∗</mo><mi>n</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">?</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathbb{Z} *_{n} ?</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.84444em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord mathbb">Z</span><span class="mord"><span class="mbin">∗</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.151392em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">n</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">?</span></span></span></span></span> ) The answer is quite simple:</p>
<p><strong>Theorem 13.3</strong><br>
<em><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span></span></span></span></span> has a multiplicative inverse mod <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span> <strong>if and only if</strong> <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">gcd</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>n</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>1.</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\operatorname{gcd}(x, n)=1 .</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mop"><span class="mord mathrm">gcd</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1.</span></span></span></span></span> In other words, <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msubsup><mi mathvariant="double-struck">Z</mi><mi>n</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∗</mo></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>∈</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathbb{Z}_{n}^{*}=\{x \in</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.93589em; vertical-align: -0.247em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathbb">Z</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.688696em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.453em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">11</span></span></span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">∗</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.248108em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mopen">{</span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="minner">⋯</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">10</span><span class="mclose">}</span><span class="mord">.</span></span></span></span></span></em></p>
<p><strong>Example</strong><br>
We can use <strong>Sage</strong><sup class="footnote-ref"><a href="#fn3" id="fnref3">3</a></sup> to play around with these concepts. Sage supports the % operator for modulus:</p>
<blockquote>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">2 \times 8</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.72777em; vertical-align: -0.08333em;"></span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">8</span></span></span></span></span> %  15<br>
1</p>
</blockquote>
<p><em>It also supports a convenient way to generate “Z<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mrow></mrow><mi>n</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">_{n}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.301392em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class=""></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.151392em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">n</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>-objects,” or Mod-objects as they are called. An object like Mod (2,15) represents the value <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>∈</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="double-struck">Z</mi><mn>15</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">2 \in \mathbb{Z}_{15},</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68354em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">∈</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.88333em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathbb">Z</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">15</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mpunct">,</span></span></span></span></span> and all of its operations are overloaded to be the mod-15 operations:</em></p>
<blockquote>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">M</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">o</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">d</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>15</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>∗</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{Mod}(2,15) * 8</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">Mod</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">15</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">∗</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">8</span></span></span></span></span><br>
1<br>
<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">M</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">o</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">d</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>15</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>31415926</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{Mod}(2,15)+31415926</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">Mod</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">15</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">31415926</span></span></span></span></span><br>
3<br>
<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">M</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">o</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">d</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>15</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{Mod}(-1,15)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">Mod</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">−</span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">15</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span><br>
14</p>
</blockquote>
<p><em>In Sage, you can compute multiplicative inverses in a few different ways:</em></p>
<blockquote>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">M</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">o</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">d</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>15</mn><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∧</mo></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{Mod}(2,15)^{\wedge}-1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.00189em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">Mod</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">15</span><span class="mclose"><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.751892em;"><span class="" style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">∧</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span></span><br>
8<br>
<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">M</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">o</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">d</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>15</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1 / \mathtt{Mod}(2,15)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">1/</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">Mod</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">15</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span><br>
8<br>
<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>2.</mn><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">i</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">n</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">v</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">r</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">_</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">m</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">o</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">d</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>15</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">2 . \mathtt{inverse\_mod}(15)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">2.</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">inverse_mod</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">15</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span><br>
8<br>
<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">(1 / 2)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">1/2</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span> % <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">15</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">15</span></span></span></span></span><br>
8</p>
</blockquote>
<p><em>Sage is smart enough to know when a multiplicative inverse doesn’t exist:</em></p>
<blockquote>
<p>sage: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">M</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">o</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">d</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>15</mn><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∧</mo></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{Mod}(3,15)^{\wedge}-1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.00189em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">Mod</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">3</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord">15</span><span class="mclose"><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.751892em;"><span class="" style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">∧</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span></span><br>
ZeroDivisionError: inverse of Mod (3,15) does not exist</p>
</blockquote>
<p><em>Sage supports huge integers, with no problem:</em></p>
<blockquote>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3141592653589793238462643383279502884197169399375105820974944</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathrm{n}=3141592653589793238462643383279502884197169399375105820974944</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathrm">n</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">3141592653589793238462643383279502884197169399375105820974944</span></span></span></span></span><br>
<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x=1234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901</span></span></span></span></span><br>

<p>The relationship between multiplicative inverses and GCD goes even farther than Theorem 13.3. Recall that we can compute <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">gcd</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>n</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\operatorname{gcd}(x, n)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mop"><span class="mord mathrm">gcd</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span> efficiently using Euclid’s algorithm. There is a relatively simple modification to Euclid’s algorithm that also computes the corresopnding Bezout coefficients with little extra work. In other words, given <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span></span></span></span></span> and <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span>, it is possible to efficiently compute integers <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">a, b,</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.88888em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">a</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">b</span><span class="mpunct">,</span></span></span></span></span> and <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">d</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.69444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span></span></span></span></span> such that<br>
<span class="katex--display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">gcd</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>n</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
a x+b n=d=\operatorname{gcd}(x, n)
</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.66666em; vertical-align: -0.08333em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">a</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.69444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">bn</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.69444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mop"><span class="mord mathrm">gcd</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></span><br>
In the case where <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">gcd</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>n</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\operatorname{gcd}(x, n)=d=1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mop"><span class="mord mathrm">gcd</span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.166667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.69444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span></span>, the integer <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">a</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span>. The “extended Euclidean algorithm” for GCD is given below:</p>

\begin{array}{|l|}\hline
\underline{EXTGCD(x,y):}\\
\quad// \text{returns $(d,a,b)$ such that gcd$(x,y)=d=ax+by$}\\
\quad \text{if}\ y=0\\
\qquad \text{return}\ (x,1,0)\\
\quad \text{else:}\\
\qquad (d,a,b):=\text{EXTGCD}(y,x\ \%\ y)\\
\qquad \text{return} (d,b,a-b[x/y])\\\hline
\end{array}

<p><strong>Example</strong><br>
<em>Sage implements the extended Euclidean algorithm as “xgcd”:</em></p>

<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">x</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">c</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">d</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{xgcd}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">xgcd</span></span></span></span></span></span>(427,529)<br>
(1, 223, -180)<br>
<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: 223 <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>∗</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">*</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.46528em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">∗</span></span></span></span></span> 427 + (-180) <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>∗</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">*</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.46528em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">∗</span></span></span></span></span> 529<br>
1</p>
</blockquote>
<p><em>You can then see that 223 and 427 are multiplicative inverses mod 529:</em></p>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="monospace">s</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">a</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">g</mi><mi mathvariant="monospace">e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathtt{sage}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.65278em; vertical-align: -0.22222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathtt">sage</span></span></span></span></span></span>: 427 <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>∗</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">*</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.46528em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">∗</span></span></span></span></span> 223  % 529<br>
1</p>
<h3 id="the-totient-function">The Totient Function</h3>

<p>As an example, if <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mord">.</span></span></span></span></span> To see why, let’s count how many elements in <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="double-struck">Z</mi><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathbb{Z}_{p q}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.974998em;
